bioghist.p: John Wilson (d. 1896) was a Presbyterian minister who preached in St. Paul, Minnesota, and churches throughout the Western United States, including churches in Colorado, Illinois, New Mexico, and Iowa. He was the father of Harry Noble Wilson.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of John Wilson. Materials include: sermons, with locations and dates of sermons often noted on cover (titles include "The Indian Messiah," "Treasures of the snow" "Pray without ceasing," "It is naught -- or Covetousness," and "The best proof -- a healed life"); notes from sermons and lectures taken by Wilson while at the Western Theological Seminary, Allegheny City, Pennsylvania, 1862; and two letters -- one to Wilson from unknown writer, 1893 and the other from Wilson to Harriet Holland in 1866.
